version_description:
We're about to turn a corner *ahem* and can't wait to tell you all about it soon...but in the meantime:

- You might notice that your Card area looks a little different. More on that to come!
- We’ve also added a new Card Limits screen to give you even more control.
- Lastly, we’ve fixed some crashes and zapped a few bugs. Because we’re nice like that.

Need to send money abroad? You can now send an international money transfer straight from the app – just jump into the Pay section to explore our available countries and currencies! And as always – we'd love your feedback on this beta release.
We've improved our international payments experience by smoothing out some bugs. We've also made the transaction feed more discoverable and added daily spend totals.

• We now supports sending USD payments to the United States.
• We've updated the design of our login screens including passcode, Touch ID and Face ID and made adjustments to improve the consistency of your log in experience.
• General performance enhancements including improving, the legibility of your goal names, the speed to load your spending insights per month and addressing timeouts when using live chat to contact our customer service team.

Self-employed? Great news – we’ve just opened up our Business account to sole traders.

We’re starting by making them available to customers who have a personal account and we’ll be making them available to everyone else soon.

• You can now add notes and attachments to all your transactions: jot down reminders, add images of receipts or attach a photo of Dave at dinner.
• Want to check on that refund? Transaction search helps you find retailers, people, Goals and references more easily.
• New toggle alert! Use Card Control to block payments at betting and gambling merchants.
• Confirm your identity quickly with customer support using an in-app code.
• Didn’t turn on notifications during onboarding? Turn them on in app with a tap.
• Finally, as usual, we’ve been waging war on bugs. Zap.

• Joint accounts have landed! Simplify shared spending, manage monthly bills or save for something great together – as long as you’re in the same room, you can set yours up from the sofa in less than five minutes.
• It’s good to share – so you can now share transaction attachments like receipts and notes on social media and messengers.
• And finally, as ever, we’ve continued to fight the good fight against bugs.
In this release, we’ve been waging war on bugs. Zap.

We're about to turn a corner *ahem* and can't wait to tell you all about it soon...but in the meantime:

- You might notice that your Card area looks a little different. More on that to come!
- We’ve also added a new Card Limits screen to give you even more control.
- Lastly, we’ve fixed some crashes and zapped a few bugs. Because we’re nice like that.

• You might notice that your Customer Service section has had a bit of a facelift – and we’ve also added some new and much improved FAQ’s.
• Been struggling with crashes when you’ve launched the app or in your card section? Struggle no more – that’s fixed.
• Finally, as ever, bugs drew the short straw this week. Sorry, bugs.

• As usual, we’ve been on a bug fixing mission, and we’ve also been making small improvements to the app’s stability.
• But mainly we’ve been laying the groundwork for some of the exciting new features we’ve got coming up (more on which later).
• That’s all folks – for now.

• As usual, we’ve been on a bug fixing mission, and we’ve also been making small improvements to the app’s stability.
• But mainly we’ve been laying the groundwork for some of the exciting new features we’ve got coming up (more on which later).
• That’s all folks – for now.

- We’re rolling out loans! Apply in minutes from your app and once you’re approved, you’ll be able to spread the cost of big ticket items and choose a repayment time period and monthly repayment amount that suits you.

- If you’ve got more than one Starling account (Business, Joint, Personal) you can now choose which account you want to pay from when using Settle Up, or choose which account you want to connect to a Marketplace partner’s app.

- Finally, some services require you to send them a 1p payment to them to validate your account. You can now make a bank transfer of as little as £0.01 from your Starling app.

What to look out for this week:

- It’s been death by a thousand lines of code for bugs this week. Seen the odd issue in Loans? They should all be fixed.
- Plus we’ve vanquished a fair few Marketplace bugs too, so if you’ve had trouble linking Marketplace partners to your account recently, that should all be fine now too.
- Finally, good news for our non-binary friends! As of this release, gender neutral titles are a go.

This week, we’re launching Nearby Payments, which allows you to pay or get paid by other Starling customers if they’re nearby – no sort codes or account numbers required! Tap on Nearby Payments from your Payments screen to get started.

We’re also making the Starling experience - including Apple Pay, Insights, Goals, Settle Up and Nearby Payments - available to customers aged 16 and 17 (although they won’t be eligible for an overdraft or loan).

New this week:
• By popular demand: if you own more than one business, you can now create a different Starling for Business account for each of them!
• We’ve also played around with the look and feel of Goals.
• Set up a Marketplace partner? You can now easily swipe on them to find and use the different products they offer.
• Finally, we’ve given the way your app starts up some TLC - it looks a little nicer now, plus it should be faster too.

New this week:
• By popular demand: if you own more than one business, you can now create a different Starling for Business account for each of them!
• We’ve also played around with the look and feel of Goals.
• Set up a Marketplace partner? You can now easily swipe on them to find and use the different products they offer.
• Finally, we’ve given the way your app starts up some TLC - it looks a little nicer now, plus it should be faster too.
This week we've made it easier to withdraw money from your Goals. As ever, the Starling app’s been a no-fly zone for bugs.
This week we've made it easier to withdraw money from your Goals. As ever, the Starling app’s been a no-fly zone for bugs.
As usual, we’ve been on a bug fixing mission, and we’ve also been making small improvements to the app’s stability.

This week, the sky’s the limit(ed) for Starling for Business customers! If you’re a limited company, you can now use the Current Account Switch Service to move all your banking to Starling and get complete visibility over your money.

The head(less)lines this week:

- Started with Starling for Business but got your eye on our Personal account? As of this release, it’s yours to apply for!
- Hefty payment in the pipeline? You can now make payments over £25k directly from your app (just make sure you get in touch first).
- We’ve also added the ability to remove paid-off loans from your loans space and fixed a minor visual glitch in Goals.
- In more ghoulish news – your app may soon acquire a Halloween horror or two in honour of spooky season. Be afraid.

• Joined at the chip? You can now use the Current Account Switch Service to switch your joint account over to Starling and manage your money together and all in one place.
• If you’ve reinstalled your app or want to log in to your account on a new device, we’ve now added some extra info and guidance to those first screens, just in case you need a hand. Oh and we’ve made it look a bit prettier too – because we’re good like that.

• Using the Current Account Switch Service to switch a sole trader account over to Starling? Good news – we’ve now made the whole process far more similar to the one that limited companies and Joint accounts get (in short: it now looks and works a lot better!)
• We’ve also made sure that you can now switch a business bank account into your sole trader account, instead of just a personal account.
• As ever, we’ve been the bane of the bug community and have been zapping with abandon. Sorry bugs.

This week's release is jam-packed with new features!

• Tap on an instant notification and from now on, you’ll be taken directly to the screen for that specific payment, instead of the Pulse.
• We’ve made some changes to the app’s layout when it’s on iPad – it’s now presented in full screen.
• Our Business Marketplace is now live and kicking! Integration with Xero is available for a limited number of customers, but it’ll be open to everyone over the coming weeks.
• Like visualising your Goals with images? Want to do the same in Loans? Good news – you can now add an image of your choosing to each of your existing loans.
• Finally – we’re excited to announce that we’ve launched deposits and withdrawals at the Post Office! You’ll notice some updated FAQ’s in your app to support that.

This week's release is jam-packed with new features!

• Tap on an instant notification and from now on, you’ll be taken directly to the screen for that specific payment, instead of the Pulse.
• We’ve made some changes to the app’s layout when it’s on iPad – it’s now presented in full screen.
• Our Business Marketplace is now live and kicking! Integration with Xero is available for a limited number of customers, but it’ll be open to everyone over the coming weeks.
• Like visualising your Goals with images? Want to do the same in Loans? Good news – you can now add an image of your choosing to each of your existing loans.
• Finally – we’re excited to announce that we’ve launched deposits and withdrawals at the Post Office! You’ll notice some updated FAQ’s in your app to support that.

This week…

We’ve redesigned our account switcher. Applying for a different kind of account now feels easier and more accessible (and switching between existing accounts is a lot smoother, too).

Personal spending: now more personal. Changed the spending category for a specific transaction? You can now apply it to all the past and future transactions for that merchant.

Rounding things off in a pleasingly meta fashion: we’ve released a new feature that’s all about, well…features. From now on, whenever we launch something new, we’ll tell you all about it in-app.

Until next week!

Here's this week's...round up:

• In the likely event that that cryptic clue went straight over your head – we're excited to announce that Starling saving just got smarter with the addition of Round Ups! You can now round up whatever you spend to the nearest pound and we'll automatically add the extra to the Goal of your choosing. Ker-ching.
• Speaking of spending: you can now also export your statements between particular dates that you choose, rather than just individual set months.

That's all for now. Happy saving!

Just a few pre-holiday updates today.
• We’re shaking things up on your home screen with a little festive surprise (hint: give your phone a shake!).
• As ever, we’ve also continued to fight the good fight against bugs.

This week…

We can’t make your gas bill vanish here at Starling – sorry – but we can remind you when it’s coming up. From now on, whenever you’ve got a scheduled payment on the horizon – a gas bill, say, or your monthly WiFi payment – it’ll appear right at the top of your transaction list the day before it’s due.

This week we’re starting new Starlings off with a bang!

About to set up an account? Good news – we’ve given our initial screens a bit of a shake up to give you a better idea of all the good stuff that’s in store.

We’ve also mortally offended a few bugs, so they’ve slunk off back from whence they came. Good riddance.

We’ve made it far speedier – and a lot more simple – to save payees and pay them.

Also this week we’ve fixed some crashes and a few bugs.

This week...
You can now transfer between any of your Starling accounts with a tap (no more setting up a new payee!)
And, as ever, we’ve been the bane of the bug community and ironed out a few problems.

Today we're delighted to announce that Starling Euro accounts have officially landed! Here's a quick rundown...

• Hold euros and send and receive euro payments – all for free.
• Transfer between your accounts to convert your money at the real exchange rate.
• Interested? Tap 'Get another Starling account' and look out for the 'Euro account' section. If it's not there yet, don't worry – it will be within a few weeks.

Today we're delighted to announce that Starling Euro accounts have officially landed! Here's a quick rundown...
• Hold euros and send and receive euro payments – all for free.
• Transfer between your accounts to convert your money at the real exchange rate.
• Interested? Tap 'Get another Starling account' and look out for the 'Euro account' section. If it's not there yet, don't worry – it will be within a few weeks.

The headlines this week…

• All onboard! We’ve given our account application process a fresh lick of paint this week – it’s a lot clearer and easier to move through now (and looks nicer too).
• We’ve also added a few extra questions to your FAQs.
• Finally, in the (mildly paraphrased) words of the inimitable TLC: no, we don’t want no bugs – so this week we’ve gone at them hammer and tongs

The headlines this week…
• All onboard! We’ve given our account application process a fresh lick of paint this week – it’s a lot clearer and easier to move through now (and looks nicer too).
• We’ve also added a few extra questions to your FAQs.
• Finally, in the (mildly paraphrased) words of the inimitable TLC: no, we don’t want no bugs – so this week we’ve gone at them hammer and tongs

The headlines this week:

• You can now edit your existing standing orders without having to recreate them from scratch.
• We’ve improved the app’s layout on devices with smaller screens.
• As usual, we’ve been fixing plenty of bugs.

Greetings all app-lings.
For all you SMEs moving to new pastures, new premises or new galaxies: you can now set or update a correspondence address for your company in the business details section of the app.
In other news, we've been zapping more bugs than a game of Space Invaders. Power Up.

As the old adage goes – just because you can’t see it, doesn’t mean it’s not there. Nothing huge to report this week, but as ever, we’ve been fixing, tinkering and ironing out virtual creases. All the good stuff that makes your app more pleasant, fast and friendly to use. Until next time!

Big news. Bigger than the new PM. Even bigger than recent temperatures. Brace yourself – because we've just launched business accounts for companies with more than one Person of Significant Control at the helm. Plus a couple of less newsworthy bug fixes.
We’re releasing our new FAQs into the wild today, which happens to be little less bug-ridden – thanks to a few fixes we made ahead of the big reveal.

When stuff goes wrong in the Starling app, our first move is to chant Coldplay's Fix You at the offending line of code until it starts behaving itself. When that doesn’t work, we try the normal way, which is less fun but usually more effective: lots of adjusting, tinkering and dilemma-solving. Less Fix You, more Fix Your Problem.

Extra evidence required? No need to message Sherlock (aka our customer service team) for this case - if you need to upload additional documents for proof of address or a name change for your personal account, you can now do so in-app.

And of course we’ve banished some pesky bugs in this weekly update. Elementary, my dear Watson.

Extra evidence required? No need to message Sherlock (aka our customer service team) for this case - if you need to upload additional documents for proof of address or a name change for your personal account, you can now do so in-app.

And of course we’ve banished some pesky bugs in this weekly update. Elementary, my dear Watson.

Our engineers are sort of like ghostbusters. Without proton packs. Or Bill Murray. Or ghosts.

Instead, they’re working with laptops, code…and a whole lotta bugs. This week they’ve busted a whole bunch of them, including one that was stopping you from manually updating your address in-app. Who you gonna call?
As ever, we’ve been on a bug fixing mission, making improvements to the app’s stability.

Our engineers have been working hard this week - you could say they're like personal trainers for our app.

This time round the update includes some minor performance improvements and the usual bug fixes, to keep everything running in tip top shape. Now for some post workout hydration.

Our engineers have been working hard this week - you could say they're like personal trainers for our app.

This time round the update includes some minor performance improvements and the usual bug fixes, to keep everything running in tip top shape. Now for some post workout hydration.

No such thing as too many cooks here! Our engineers have been busy in the kitchen (aka the office) whipping up some fresh code to keep your app looking spick and span. The usual bug fixes are the plat du jour of the update this week. Bon appétit!

No such thing as too many cooks here! Our engineers have been busy in the kitchen (aka the office) whipping up some fresh code to keep your app looking spick and span. The usual bug fixes are the plat du jour of the update this week. Bon appétit!

This week we’ve made it a little easier for you to access your personal details settings. Just tap on the account menu in the top right of your home screen to find them.

Finally, if we can’t currently offer you an overdraft (it might be that you’re just not eligible, your account type doesn’t qualify or your account’s still being verified) from now on we’ll tell you about it – no more guessing games!

A small but cartographically satisfying update this week. From now on, you’ll always be able to see a map alongside your transactions details, so you can see exactly where you spent what. That’s it for now!

Bad news for imposters – great news for you. As you use your app this week, you might start to see the occasional tip on the subject of fraud (for example, when you’re adding a new payee or paying someone for the first time). We do everything we can to keep your money safe, but we’ve added this extra info to help you look after things at your end. Until next time!
If you’re a business account newcomer, you might see a few changes. That’s it for now!
If you’re a business account newcomer, you might see a few changes. That’s it for now!

This week, earn your stripes – or better yet, control them. You’ll now be able to manage whether your card can make magnetic Stripe payments (which is great news for fraud prevention!). Just navigate to card controls in your app.

New friends? Lovely. New payees? Not that lovely. So we've given your Pay Someone New flow a little spit and polish to make it easier to speed through those first-timers (which means we've added things like smarter formatting for IBANs and sort codes, among other stuff). Lovely indeed.

Keep forgetting where to set up new scheduled payments? That's on us – it wasn't as clear as it could have been, but it's a lot easier to find now. As you were.

New friends? Lovely. New payees? Not that lovely. So we've given your Pay Someone New flow a little spit and polish to make it easier to speed through those first-timers (which means we've added things like smarter formatting for IBANs and sort codes, among other stuff). Lovely indeed.
Keep forgetting where to set up new scheduled payments? That's on us – it wasn't as clear as it could have been, but it's a lot easier to find now. As you were.

Finding the answers to life’s big questions – like ‘Can I withdraw cash at the Post Office?’ – has never been easier, now that you can search in our FAQs. We’ve also made some design changes to our Customer Support and Starling inboxes – nothing wildly different, don’t worry. And, of course, no update would be complete without a couple of bug fixes and performance improvements.

Card gone missing? Or accidentally found its way into the washing machine? We’ve made it easier than ever to order a replacement – just go to the card section of the app. And while we were at it, we fixed a few minor bugs, too.

Greetings all app-lings.
For all you SMEs moving to new pastures, new premises or new galaxies: you can now set or update a correspondence address for your company in the business details section of the app.
In other news, we've been zapping more bugs than a game of Space Invaders. Power Up.

Greetings all app-lings.
For all you SMEs moving to new pastures, new premises or new galaxies: you can now set or update a correspondence address for your company in the business details section of the app.
In other news, we've been zapping more bugs than a game of Space Invaders. Power Up.

Can’t get enough of paying other people money? Ok yeah, probably not, but at least now it’s faster and easier than ever thanks to this week’s renovations.

Expect a freshly streamlined look and feel from your payment screens, as well as some key improvements to their structure and navigation. Keep an eye out for your most recent payees, which are now front and centre, as well as your balance on each of your accounts, which you’ll now be able to see at a glance. We’ve also given your payment flow a lick of paint so it feels sharp and seamless to use – because, well, why not eh.

Big news. Bigger than the new PM. Even bigger than recent temperatures. Brace yourself – because we've just launched business accounts for companies with more than one Person of Significant Control at the helm. Plus a couple of less newsworthy bug fixes.

Big news. Bigger than the new PM. Even bigger than recent temperatures. Brace yourself – because we've just launched business accounts for companies with more than one Person of Significant Control at the helm. Plus a couple of less newsworthy bug fixes.

Big news. Bigger than the new PM. Even bigger than recent temperatures. Brace yourself – because we've just launched business accounts for companies with more than one Person of Significant Control at the helm. Plus a couple of less newsworthy bug fixes.

As the old adage goes – just because you can’t see it, doesn’t mean it’s not there. Nothing huge to report this week, but as ever, we’ve been fixing, tinkering and ironing out virtual creases. All the good stuff that makes your app more pleasant, fast and friendly to use. Until next time!

Puff Daddy becoming P. Diddy – a rebranding exercise that seems almost trivial in light of what we’ve just done to the Customer Service section of the app. It’s now called Help _(WE KNOW)_ and we’ve introduced an unread badge to let you know when you’ve got a new customer service message.
The Help topics have also been given a thorough jazzing up, too.

Gripping dispatches from the app-crashing-when-resetting-my-password frontline.
Basically – it's all fixed. That's it. That's the dispatch. Bye for now.

When stuff goes wrong in the Starling app, our first move is to chant Coldplay's Fix You at the offending line of code until it starts behaving itself. When that doesn’t work, we try the normal way, which is less fun but usually more effective: lots of adjusting, tinkering and dilemma-solving. Less Fix You, more Fix Your Problem.
iOS 0.99.0, our palindromic release, is strictly sub rosa tinkering in preparation for a big announcement from us at Sibos. Mum's the word.
We’re releasing our new FAQs into the wild today, which happens to be little less bug-ridden – thanks to a few fixes we made ahead of the big reveal.
Nothing too exciting to report this time – other than some action-packed bug fixes AND mind-blowing optimisations. Under promise, over deliver; that’s how you do it, folks.
Are you seated? Are you comfortable? Are you mentally prepared for Starling Bank 1.2.0? Marvel at the new info screens after onboarding, as well as the various bug fixes and performance improvements.
Are you seated? Are you comfortable? Are you mentally prepared for Starling Bank 1.3.0? Marvel at the new info screens after onboarding, as well as the various bug fixes and performance improvements.
Friends, Europeans, travellers, lend us your ears. Our euro business account, multi-currency card controls and weekend FX are all now live. Allez, allez, allez!
All quiet on the western front this week. Which broadly means: we've done a lot, but nothing that sounds very exciting on a release note. Check back in soon though – there's plenty in the works.
All quiet on the western front this week. Which broadly means: we've done a lot, but nothing that sounds very exciting on a release note. Check back in soon though – there's plenty in the works.

First order of business: if you’re not the only director in your business, you can now add someone else – or multiple someone else’s – to your Starling account to give them all the same access and controls as you. Just send them an invitation through your app to kick things off.
Oh, and we’ve given password resetting a reboot too, so if you forget yours, it’s now super simple to change it and get back into your account. And scene.

We recently hit the rather exciting milestone of one million accounts – so to celebrate, we’re putting our feet up and enjoying some well-deserved R&R. You know – Really hard work and Refining all our features. Watch this space.
Payments are now safer than ever, thanks to some recent improvements we made to fraud detection. Now give yourself some time to sigh that sigh of sweet, sweet relief. There it is!

If you’re afraid of commitment, look away now. We’ve put all your recurring payments together in one easy-to-manage place. Direct debits, standing orders, subscriptions – you name them, they’re there. Or not – if you don't think one belongs, just hide it.
We’re always tinkering with the app, making sure it’s the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

Thanks to a recent remodel, your home screen has officially never looked better. Should you manage to see past its superficial delights, you’ll notice we’ve also built a MonthlyPulse™, which is a simple breakdown of everything you’ve spent that month. All together now: there's no place like home(screen).

Snowglobe mode: activated. If you were a Starling customer this time last year, you'll already know all about our app's subtle and much-loved annual festive facelift. If not? Update, then shake, to let it snow, let it snow, let it snow...
We’re always tinkering with the app, making sure it’s the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

Some of our business customers told us that our spending categories weren't really cutting it – so we did the decent thing and created a brand new set. They're now far more helpful – think things like Income, Expenses and Tax Payments – and we're hoping they'll make staying organised that little bit easier. As you were!
We're always tinkering with the app, making sure it's the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

As it happens, Gabrielle was right – dreams really do come true. You can now download your tax year interest statements (which will make submitting Self Assessment tax returns that much simpler).
We're always tinkering with the app, making sure it's the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

We love it when new customers open their accounts at Starling and this release adds some more friendly messages to help get started. We've also been working hard to improve our business banking toolkit, adding support for making bulk payments from online banking.
We're always tinkering with the app, making sure it's the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

This week’s main update: you can now preview PDF statements before you export them. Other than that, just a few bug fixes, really. Remember the one that made the keyboard appear over the chat box? Neither do we. Gone. Old news. History.
We're always tinkering with the app, making sure it's the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!
Just a few tweaks to report this week. The glitch on links to help articles? Gone. And to prepare for the launch of cheque imaging, we’ve also updated our FAQs. That's your lot!
Just a few tweaks to report this week. The glitch on links to help articles? Gone. And to prepare for the launch of cheque imaging, we’ve also updated our FAQs. That's your lot!
Homebodies, new and old - we come bearing good news. We’re doing a phased roll-out of mobile cheque deposits, meaning you can now pay in cheques without having to leave the house.
Homebodies, new and old - we come bearing good news. We’re doing a phased roll-out of mobile cheque deposits, meaning you can now pay in cheques without having to leave the house.
We’re always tinkering with the app, making sure it’s the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!
We’re always tinkering with the app, making sure it’s the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

If someone's helping you shop for essentials at the moment – listen up! We're excited to announce that we've just launched the Connected card; an additional debit card that allows someone you trust to spend on your behalf (from a set amount in a designated Space only). You'll find it in Spaces once you've updated your app.

If someone's helping you shop for essentials at the moment – listen up! We're excited to announce that we've just launched the Connected card; an additional debit card that allows someone you trust to spend on your behalf (from a set amount in a designated Space only). You'll find it in Spaces once you've updated your app.
Customers with Connected cards can now see a list of transactions made from their designated Space. Forgotten the PIN on your Connected card? Just ask for a reminder via the app.

This week, we’ve been working hard to get the Business Toolkit ready for launch. For a small monthly fee, this optional feature will come with bookkeeping and VAT tools to save you time and admin. You'll be able to add it to your account soon, but not just yet. Watch this space.
We’re always tinkering with the app, making sure it’s the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

Saving up for the things you want just got more aesthetically pleasing, thanks to the brand new layout for Spaces.
If you’ve already spring-cleaned and alphabetised everything in your flat, you're in luck – as you can now give your Spaces the Mary Poppins treatment, too. Organise them in any order you like.

We've been rolling out some updates to 3D Secure payments (in short: you’ll soon be approving them with a push notification or code, instead of by SMS). If nothing changes straight away, don't worry; we're rolling it out gradually and so you may just see a change on your card screen for now.

Remember the old Marketplace screens? Gone – and replaced by a smarter, clearer dashboard that shows you all your connected services at a glance. Marketplace integrations, external services: you'll now see everything listed as a tile on your dashboard, linking through to its own management screen once you tap through (think Spaces, but for your services!). Plus you'll be able to re-organise your dashboard in any order you like.

Using the Starling app on an iPad? You can now flip your screen around and enjoy it in landscape mode.
Using the Starling app on an iPad? You can now flip your screen around and enjoy it in landscape mode.

This week, our app updates are wearing an invisibility cloak. Which, in other words, means they’re too minor and functional to tell you about. But don’t worry, they’re there, hiding in the shadows. Spooky.

We’ve given the iPad version of Spending Insights some attention this week, in the form of a new split screen layout. Insights on the left, your transactions on the right – and the full picture of your spending, right there on one screen. From split screens to squashed bugs: there were a few of those this week, too.
We’re always tinkering with the app, making sure it’s the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

Rome wasn’t built in a day. For a start, togas and manual labour make for awkward bedfellows, but also, Romans knew Colosseums are the result of lots of small daily improvements (yes, we just compared Starling to a wonder of the world). Not many visual changes this week – but plenty of construction work going on behind the scenes.
We’re always tinkering with the app, making sure it’s the best it can possibly be. So treat yourself to the latest version, complete with bug fixes, tweaks and improvements. Enjoy!

It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas in the Starling app! We’ve turned the Pulse into a snow globe; just give your phone a shake and virtual snow will start to fall. You can also add a dusting of snow to the main app icon – or a Santa hat, whatever takes your festive fancy.

This week, our app updates are wearing an invisibility cloak. Which, in other words, means they’re too minor and functional to tell you about. But don’t worry, they’re there, hiding in the shadows. Spooky.

If big exciting product launches are our marathon, think of this release as a 5k training run. Improvements made, great strides taken, bugs squished – but mainly a behind-the-scenes slog that no-one really needs to hear about.

Not many visual changes this week – but plenty of construction work going on behind the scenes.

As app updates go, v.1.80.0 is a pretty big one. We’ve updated the navigation layout, so you can access different parts of your account more easily. We’ve also added an account switcher at the top, allowing you to jump between different accounts in a tap. Last and probably least, we made a few bug fixes and improvements, too.

Two apps, one screen – say hello to iPad Multitasking! You can now keep the Starling app open alongside your emails, photos or whatever else you need.

This week, our app updates are wearing an invisibility cloak. Which, in other words, means they’re too minor and functional to tell you about. But don’t worry, they’re there, hiding in the shadows. Spooky.

If you sometimes make same-currency payments, good news: you’ll now be able to see your available balance when you’re making a payment (and we’ve added a confirmation screen so you’re never in danger of making one by mistake). Transferring between your accounts has had some love, too: it’s now a lot clearer which account you’re paying money from and to.

Did you know the Eiffel Tower has 2.5 million screws holding it together? That’s how you do flatpack furniture properly. This week, we’ve been adding some nuts and bolts of our own to the app. You won’t notice any visual changes, but our updates are adding a little va va voom behind the scenes.

When Leonardo Da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa, he used brushstrokes so tiny that you need a microscope to see them. This week we’ve been applying some perfect strokes of our own to the app - too little to see individually, but helping to paint something grander. They’ll hang us in the Louvre someday too!

We’ll soon be dropping support for devices running iOS 9, so make sure your device runs a newer version of iOS.

Hey big spenders. The contactless limit has risen from £45 to £100! But with this week's update you can set your own limit, if you like. Use our slider to set your limit anywhere between £10 and £100, or just choose to turn contactless off. More power to you!

This week, our app updates are wearing an invisibility cloak. Which, in other words, means they’re too minor and functional to tell you about. But don’t worry, they’re there, hiding in the shadows. Spooky.

Remember, remember the 5th November… and the 12th, and the 17th. When your bills go out at different times of the month, keeping track of them can be tricky. But our new feature, Bills Manager, requires less plotting. Pay your bills from a Saving Space instead of your main balance, and get a clear picture of how much money you have for day-to-day spending.
